title: School steps in to give classes to Afghan children living in hotel
description: Hear from Afghan teenagers who are receiving English lessons, thanks to a local school.

title: Can Online Safety Bill tackle social media abuse of MPs?
description: After Sir David Amess' death, we look at the detail of the Online Safety Bill and what measures it offers.

title: Ros Atkins on… Europe's climate challenge
description: Ros Atkins looks at how Europe is getting to grips with its emissions problem.

title: Capitol riots officer: The moment the mob took me
description: Video from outside the Capitol shows police officer Mike Fanone scream as he was tasered in the head.

title: Myanmar: Mass release of political prisoners
description: Some of the political prisoners released by the authorities in Myanmar describe how they endured life in jail.

title: Prevent scheme: Why the government's programme is so difficult
description: The strategy aimed at stopping people becoming terrorists is facing calls for it to be overhauled.

title: Severe pregnancy illness: 'I won't have another baby'
description: Laura Anderson shares her experience of hyperemesis gravidarum (HG) during her pregnancy two years ago.

title: The US suburban couple accused of a bungled treason plot
description: The Toebbes seemed to have everything - so why did they allegedly try to sell nuclear secrets?

title: The Indian women widowed by Covid-19
description: In India, Covid has widowed thousands of women, who are now struggling to adjust to a new life.

title: When a cobra became a murder weapon in India
description: A 28-year-old man killed his wife using a cobra, in what prosecutors say is the first crime of its kind.

title: 'I've never played a match like that' - Murray wins Antwerp marathon
description: Andy Murray shows all of his quality and fight to edge past Frances Tiafoe in a thrilling European Open first-round match.

title: Queen declines Oldie of the Year award
description: At 95, she does not meet the criteria because "you are only as old as you feel", the palace says.

title: Heat pump grants worth £5,000 to help replace gas boilers
description: The England and Wales grants will cover just 90,000 heat pumps out of more than 20 million households.

title: Premier League clubs vote for temporary ban on sponsorship deals linked to team owners
description: Premier League clubs vote to temporarily block teams agreeing lucrative sponsorship deals linked to a club's owners after the £305m takeover of Newcastle.

title: 'I keep crying over David's Southend dream coming true'
description: Southend is to become a city in honour of Sir David Amess, but what will it mean for people there?

title: England squad: Will Marcus Smith selection spark a more attack-minded approach?
description: What does Marcus Smith offer England and how will England play this autumn? BBC rugby union correspondent Chris Jones asks head coach Eddie Jones.

title: Southeastern and Avanti West Coast trains severely disrupted
description: Urgent track repairs are affecting services between Kent and Sussex, and London Charing Cross.

title: Heat pumps: How much do they cost and how do they work?
description: The government wants people to replace gas boilers with heat pumps.

title: Life at 50C: The Baghdad traffic cop who works in 50C heat
description: In Baghdad, Sergeant Saa’d has to brave increasingly extreme conditions to keep the city moving.

title: Lord Janner: Police shut down MP child abuse investigations - report
description: An inquiry finds police seemed "reluctant to investigate" claims against former MP Lord Janner.

title: Net zero announcement: UK sets out plans to cut greenhouse gas emissions
description: The government reveals its long-awaited strategy days before global leaders meet for COP26 in Glasgow.

title: Fenton & Stacey reach world all-around final but Downie misses out on beam and uneven bars
description: Britain's Georgia-Mae Fenton and 16-year-old Ruby Stacey are through to the all-around final of the Artistic World Championships, while Becky Downie fails to advance.

title: Alta Fixsler: Toddler dies in hospice after parents' legal battle fails
description: A judge ruled Alta Fixsler's life support should be withdrawn in a hospice rather than at home.

title: Covid-19: New mutation of Delta variant under close watch in UK
description: Scientists are studying it to better understand how much of a threat it may pose.

title: Arrest after Nottinghamshire women report nightclub needle attacks
description: Ellie Simpson says her sister felt "a pinch on the back of her arm" as she left a nightclub.

title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Bomber's brother leaves UK before hearing
description: The Manchester Arena bomber's brother Ismail Abedi has been ordered to appear as a witness.

title: NFL: 'Nobody's going to catch him!' - Derrick Henry stars as Titans beat Bills
description: Watch running back Derrick Henry score three touchdowns as the Tennessee Titans win 34-31 against the Buffalo Bills in week six of the NFL season.

title: Channel 4 subtitles and other services not likely to return until mid-November
description: A catastrophic fault knocked out subtitles, signing and audio description more than three weeks ago.

title: Little Amal: War Horse creators' refugee puppet lands in the UK
description: The 3.5m high puppet of a Syrian refugee child begins the last leg of her trans-European trek.

title: Diver finds 900-year-old crusader sword off Israel's coast
description: The blade, which is encrusted with marine organisms, is believed to be about 900 years old.

title: North Korea fires suspected submarine-launched missile into waters off Japan
description: It is thought to have been a submarine-launched ballistic missile which are harder to detect.

title: Kanye West officially changes his name to Ye
description: The rapper's name has been officially changed after a request to a Los Angeles court.

title: Eric Zemmour: Far-right journalist cast as Macron election rival
description: Eric Zemmour - tipped to run for the French presidency - is rebranding far-right nationalism.

title: 'Heaviest' kidneys removed in high-risk operation
description: Warren Higgs speaks before and after having his kidneys, which weighed more than five stone (35kg), removed.

title: Champions League: Paris St-Germain, Mauricio Pochettino, Lionel Messi, Kylian Mbappe and Neymar
description: BBC Sport analyses the task facing Mauricio Pochettino at Paris St-Germain, as he attempts to turn a squad of superstars into a team that can win the Champions League.

title: The Papers: A city 'born of grief' and call to end online hate
description: The front pages focus on MPs' tributes to Sir David Amess - and his family's visit to the scene of the killing.
